column4: I am sitting here in Live session about to install 9.04. I am going to install /home on separate partition this time. What size should I make that? I put all media on a different HDD. So, should ten gigs be enough for the time being? I have 20gigs alloted to Linux right now, total.
ok partitioning
what partitions do you already have on there?
I have 320GB. 80 is Windows, 20 is 8.04, 220 is media (ntfs)
do like  12GB  /    your swap space,  and   most of the  space being your home
So 12GB as "/"  and swap, then the other 8 as my /home sound reasonable?
not quite
8GB for home  rather small indeed
,but your going to put most data some where else anyway?
Yeah, all of it is elsewhere on another HDD/partition.
well not much point having a seperate home in your case I think
also  if you don't format  a /  partition that has  home in it, w hen you re install,   home stays in tact, I been told
Ah. I was looking to keep in on its own partition in the event I try a different distro, or for backing up purposes.
right, but   it's not exaclty hard to install programs again, if you try another distro?
and you can copy/backup relivant .folders anyway
True enough
Gotcha. I shall just go with one partition for the time being.
I been meaning to clean install for a few weeks now,  plus  I am going from Ext3 to Ext4,   most of my .folders there won't be a good reason to keep.   ,but i'll back up stuff like .mozilla
just  copy  the relivant .folders yeah
Gotcha. Thanks for the help
ok no problem
